place.name: BELCHAMP OTTEN
place.gazetteerText: BELCHAMP-OTTON, a parish in the district of Sudbury and county of Essex; on a small affluent of the river Stour, 4 miles NE of Yeldham r. station, and 5 W by N of Sudbury. Post Town, Belchamp-St. Paul, under Halstead. Acres, 1,693. Real property, £2,961. Pop., 375. Houses, 81. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £446.* Patron, the representatives of the late Rev. E. H. Dawson. The church is good; and there are charities £21. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
